name: places/ChIJqY35X7JZwokRJ0YHsR3pHik
formattedAddress: 411 W 35th St, New York, NY 10001, USA
adrFormatAddress: 411 W 35th St, New York, NY 10001, USA

originalText.text:
I think of this place often and fondly! The Lewis was my first ever apartment in NYC and when I tell you I was spoiled rotten?! The location alone you can’t beat, the units are sleek/modern and the staff of the whole building are so sweet and kind (everyone: the Super, the office, the leasing agent, and literally everyone at the front desk —- you know who you are and I miss you!).

Work pulled me elsewhere to live but I often contemplate moving back. No building is perfect, and here applies that saying: it’s not about the set back it’s about the comeback and The Lewis is good about that.

Xo

originalText.text: “ I have had a mostly good experience and especially the Leasing Office. Rent is better than other building  I looked.  1 person in particular, George has been the most helpful in answering all my questions and going above and beyond with providing me with all the necessary information about my move in.  The Location is good . Milly, Wilson , Kris at front desk are always nice and helpful. The superintendent has been quick in addressing the maintenance issues since I moved in . One negative has been the construction of day care and playground . Annoying “

originalText.text: It is a great experience living here. Front desk are super nice and George has been really helpful and always take care of every resident. Overall, good living experience and fair rental price.

text.text: It is a great experience living here. Front desk are super nice and George has been really helpful and always take care of every resident. Overall, good living experience and fair rental price.

originalText.text: the absolute worst rental experience of my life. dont be fooled by the charming leasing agent. since spring of last year, this building has been under the loudest construction from 7AM-6PM, and the leasing office could not care less, as long as you're paying their bills. their only response to complaints from every resident here is that it is "not illegal." if they actually showed any sort of sympathy, residents here would not be so upset. instead, they say things like "well what do u want us to do?" incredibly insensitive, and they have even asked 1 star reviewers on here to remove their comments and video recordings. the crazy part? they show leasing/open-house in between construction hours. what a coincidence!

originalText.text: Have stayed for one year with the Lewis and I just renewed the lease for another one. I've enjoyed being a resident. I am very thankful to Millie, Wilson, and every managing staff who has made it home for me during the past year. The rooftop got a beautiful view to see the Hudson sunset. Highly recommend it to whom is new to the city for its best location and the home-like atmosphere.
